channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11705] callQueueSize should be decremented in a fail-fast scenario
item.description: Discussed on the user@hbase mailing list (http://markmail.org/thread/w3cqjxwo2smkn2jw). If a client disconnects the call queue size is not decremented causing new calls to get rejected with a CallQueueTooBigException.
item.summary: callQueueSize should be decremented in a fail-fast scenario

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: No tests included for now for in TestCallRunner.

The patch works, but the code would be more solid and easier to validate with a finally; if someone adds something that throws an Exception it will be caught by the final catch and we will have the same bug again.
Thanks Nicolas Liochon!. Moved callQueueSize decrement to a finally, fail-fast now is done by throwing a ClosedChannelException.

Thanks for the second version. One last question: why do you want a throw ClosedChannelException? The existing return is enough, and it eases the distinction in the logs between "skip" and "executed but the client does not care anymore"

You are right, throwing the ClosedChannelException probably is overkill considering that the call has not been processed yet. Also moving the "skipped" log line from debug to info won't help. Perhaps adding a new metric for abandoned/aborted calls?
New simpler patch based on Nicolas Liochon latest comments. Monitoring abandoned/aborted calls can be discussed in a different jira.

Monitoring abandoned/aborted calls can be discussed in a different jira

Agreed.

+1, let's see if hadoop-qa is happy...
